metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29969 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If Thunderbird was configured to use STARTTLS for an IMAP connection, and an attacker injected IMAP server responses prior to the completion of the STARTTLS handshake, then Thunderbird didn't ignore the injected data. This could have resulted in Thunderbird showing incorrect information, for example the attacker could have tricked Thunderbird to show folders that didn't exist on the IMAP server. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.12.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
